Articles.Content:
I want to just put together a quick list of the Solar-Kerbolar counterparts to all the planets.

First, Moho - Mercury (No atmosphere, high temperatures)

Eve - Venus (Very thick atmosphere)

Kerbin - Earth (You know why)

Mun - Moon (Very similar in appearance)

Duna - Mars (Cold, red in appearance)

Ike - Phobos (Roundish, more of an asteroid than a moon)

Jool - Jupiter (Relatively large number of moons, gas giant, no rings, very large SOI)

Vall - Europa (Icy moon of Jupiter)

Bop - Representative of the many non-major moons orbiting Jupiter

If you come up with others, tell me and I'll add em'.
